prior_works.title: Deep Equilibrium Models
prior_works.authors: Shaojie Bai, J. Zico Kolter, Vladlen Koltun
prior_works.relationship_sentence: Banana adopts a DEQ-style fixed-point view, engineering its update as a contraction to guarantee existence/uniqueness and to backpropagate through the equilibrium, but extends it by making the operator SE(3)-equivariant and label-permutation aware so that assignments and per-part poses co-evolve equivariantly.

prior_works.relationship_sentence: Provides the steerable, SE(3)-equivariant feature parameterization that motivates Banana’s per-step equivariant updates, ensuring that rigid motions act consistently on learned features.

prior_works.relationship_sentence: Demonstrates how to build SE(3)-equivariant interactions over point sets, informing Banana’s design of per-iteration, equivariant interactions between points and parts that preserve rigid-motion symmetry.

prior_works.relationship_sentence: The EM alternation between soft correspondences and SE(3) alignment in CPD directly inspires Banana’s co-evolution of part assignments and per-part poses, which Banana recasts as a learnable, contracting equivariant fixed-point map.

prior_works.title: Dynamic Routing Between Capsules
prior_works.authors: Sara Sabour, Geoffrey E. Hinton, Nicholas Frosst
prior_works.relationship_sentence: Capsules’ coupling of part assignments with pose parameters motivates Banana’s explicit modeling of per-part SE(3) actions tied to segmentation, while Banana adds convergence guarantees and continuous 3D equivariance.

synthesis_narrative: Banana’s core contribution—equivariant point-cloud segmentation with inter-part equivariance obtained as the fixed point of a contracting iteration—emerges from unifying three lines of prior work. First, deep implicit layers and fixed-point training (Deep Equilibrium Models) provide the blueprint to pose inference as solving for a stable equilibrium and to differentiate through it. Banana adopts this perspective but engineers the update operator to be a contraction and strictly SE(3)-equivariant, enabling proofs of per-step equivariance and global convergence. Second, advances in 3D equivariance (Tensor Field Networks, SE(3)-Transformers, and E(n)-equivariant GNNs) supply the architectural tools to ensure rigid-motion symmetry at each iteration. These works demonstrate how features and interactions can be designed so that rotations and translations act predictably—elements Banana leverages to keep its iterative map equivariant. Third, the co-evolution of assignments and transformations has deep roots in both classical registration (Coherent Point Drift’s EM alternation between soft correspondences and rigid alignment) and object-centric grouping (Slot Attention and Capsule Networks), which tie grouping to pose-like parameters under permutation symmetry. Banana synthesizes these ideas by jointly updating soft part labels and per-part SE(3) parameters through an equivariant, contracting operator. This yields a unique, equivariant fixed point that resolves the entanglement between segmentation and per-part motion, operationalizing inter-part equivariance with theoretical guarantees and practical effectiveness.
